content:
‼️ Tests and validators are currently the same, but they should be different.

I've just edited the statement as follows:

Goal
* Added line breaks between the various types of alignment.

* JUSTIFY: changed "on the same column" to "at the same rightmost position" based on the comment on the forum: https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-text-alignment/203135/4

* JUSTIFY: changed both instances of "round" to "round down".

Cases
* Added names for the validators (previously they were all empty strings).

Solution
* Updated the solution from Python 2 to Python 3.

I have checked over and approved this puzzle. Good job.

I made several modifications:

 - I added Stub generator input
 - I reformatted the entire entry to highlight variables and constants correctly
 - I changed "<=" to "≤" in Constraints
 - I added text to the CENTER description to make it clear that spaces are not expected to be added to the right of the line
 - I reformatted the Input section to make it more like CG standards
Please better define how you want the text JUSTIFIED, i cannot tell if you want it done by word spacing or letter spacing.
Exceptions for CENTER and JUSTIFIY are not explained : how to spread odd spaces ? "Rounding to the integer part" will break the right alignment on the JUSTIFY case, no ?

The original text did say "spread evenly between words".
I have added a clearer explanation on the expected rounding, though.
thank you very much,  that is a lot better.

Not that it's likely to be accepted, I think. No one seems very much interested and there are already some simpler variants.

Possibly it would be a bit better if I introduced some variations from the rickroll test cases.
